snippet: Officials would not say whether the case was related to a deadly fertilizer plant explosion in West, Tex., last month, but they opened a criminal inquiry.
abstract: Texas authorities say they have opened criminal investigation into deadly explosion at fertilizer plant that killed 14 people and injured some 200 others; announcement comes hours after Bryce Reed, paramedic who responded to the explosion, was arrested on charge of possessing components of pipe bomb.

byline.original: By TIMOTHY WILLIAMS and MANNY FERNANDEZ
byline.contributor: Ian Urbina and John Schwartz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officials would not say whether the case was related to a deadly fertilizer plant explosion in West, Tex., last month, but they opened a criminal inquiry.

headline.seo: West., Tex., E.M.T. Faces Charge of Having Bomb Parts
headline.main: E.M.T. at Fertilizer Plant Blast Faces Charge of Possessing Bomb Parts
headline.print_headline: E.M.T. at Fertilizer Plant Blast Faces Charge of Possessing Bomb Parts
